title: Communication Under Stress
content: Stress degrades communication. Under pressure, messages become shorter, less clear, and more emotional. Listening narrows. Awareness of this degradation enables compensation: deliberately slow down, use structured formats, verify more carefully when stress is high.

mcq.question: During an emergency, you notice yourself speaking faster and using shorter phrases. What should you do?

options.B: Consciously slow down and use complete, clear statements
options.C: Let others communicate while you focus on actions

mcq.explanation: Fast, fragmented communication causes errors in emergencies when errors are most costly. Deliberately slowing down and speaking clearly improves information transfer even if it feels wrong in the moment.

openQuestions: How does your communication change under stress?
What techniques help you maintain clear communication during high-pressure situations?
